New Records: Ben Stokes hit six fours and six sixes on the way to his century.
Chris Woakes stitched together a mammoth 129-run stand for the seventh wicket with Stokes in just 81 balls.
Key Match Events: Dawid Malan's attacking 87 guided England in the early stages.
Ben Stokes took charge with his intent-driven batting, taking the boundaries on offer and rotating the strike.
Chris Woakes was right on the mark with the new ball.
Ben Stokes brought up his maiden Cricket World Cup ton in the 48th over.
Pre-Game Insights: At the toss, Jos Buttler flipped the coin, and it landed in his favour. England elected to bat first, with Harry Brook and Gus Atkinson returning to the side in place of Liam Livingstone and Mark Wood.
Post-Match Reflections: England pacers and spinners were at their very best in Pune.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dutch batters took the attacking route after the 25-over mark.
Netherlands lost their final five wickets for a mere 16 runs, meaning they were bowled out for 179.
Others: England clinched victory over Netherlands during the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023, with commentator Natalie Germanos and ICC Digital Insider Ridhima Pathak.
England star Joe Root is out to make an impact whatever the role required when batting at No.3 at the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023
